intro: Cyperus brownii, commonly known as the brown rush, is a species of flowering plant in the sedge family Cyperaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Cyperus brownii is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its adaptability and aesthetic appeal.
